measurements.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /***This header file is used to create a PHI matrix (measurement matrix) and a measurement signal. It uses a predefined basis matrix (ie wavelet, discrete cosine transforms) or a learned dictionary of basis functions. It requires as input the percentage of measurements assumed to be used in the sensing system and then randomly removes the rows/data points from the patchGroundTruth_ and the basis matrix at hand.
00002 
00003 
00004 input: 
00005         -patchGroundTruth_ #vector containing the original signal
00006         -blockResolution   #constant declaring the size of the block's dimension #default=8
00007         -dictionarySize    #constant declaring the number of available basis functions
00008         -percentage        #constant controlling the percentage of original measurements used
00009         -PSI               #empty double matrix 
00010         -scale             #scale of the wavelet transform to be used
00011         -intermediate_     #empty double vector
00012         -efficientlySensedPatch_ #empty double vector
00013         -measurements      #constant returning the number of measurements sensed
00014         -sensed_           #empty bool vector
00015 output: 
00016         - intermediate_ #vector containing the acquired data points by the sensing system
00017         - PSI           #matrix containing the basis functions in its columns for all data points 
00018         - efficientlySensedPatch_ #vector containing the efficiently sensed signal patch
00019         - measurements #constant used to inform the system of the number of data points sensed
00020         - sensed_      #vector containing whether data points were sensed or not
00021         ***/
00022 
00023 
00024 void target_and_PSI_generator(vector<double> patchGroundTruth_, int blockResolution, int percentage, double *intermediate_, double *efficientlySensedPatch_, int &measurements, bool *sensed_)
00025 {
00026 
00027 /***START the patch target generator***/
00028         
00029         int random_number = 0; //store the number that will be generated randomly and based on this, it will be chosen whether it will be sensed
00030         
00031 
00032         //go through the signal patch and sense randomly with a pre-defined percentage
00033         //for (int rows=0;rows<blockResolution;rows++)
00034         //      for (int cols=0;cols<blockResolution;cols++)
00035         for (int rows=0;rows<blockResolution*blockResolution;rows++)
00036         {
00037                 random_number = rand() % 100 + 1; //generate numbers in sequence
00038 
00039                 if (random_number>percentage)
00040                         {
00041                         intermediate_[measurements] = patchGroundTruth_[rows];
00042                         efficientlySensedPatch_[rows] = patchGroundTruth_[rows];
00043                         sensed_[rows] = true;                   
00044                         measurements = measurements + 1;
00045                         }
00046                 else
00047                         {
00048                         sensed_[rows] =false;
00049                         efficientlySensedPatch_[rows] = 0;
00050                         }
00051         }
00052 
00053         //cout << "Measurements sensed: " << measurements << endl;
00054 
00055 /***END of patch target generator***/
00056 
00057 
00058         
00059 }
